meanings.definition: Hold the attention of (someone) to the exclusion of all else or so as to transfix them.
meanings.sent1: The magician's tricks seemed to mesmerise the entire audience.
meanings.sent2: The beautiful artwork had the power to mesmerise anyone who looked at it.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics never failed to mesmerise the grumpy old cat.
meanings.sent4: The starlit sky at night can mesmerise even the most cynical of hearts.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's graceful movements seemed to mesmerise time itself.

meanings.sent1: The hypnotist was able to mesmerise his volunteer into a deep sleep.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious stranger had a gaze that could mesmerise anyone who met it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to mesmerise their friends with a silly dance.
meanings.sent4: The singer's voice had the power to mesmerise the entire audience into silence.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact seemed to mesmerise all who dared to look upon it.
